title: It is impossible to edit the standard search engine
content: I wanted to set keywords for search engines (in order to quickly change them for a single query). This cannot be done for search engines by default (why?), so I had to delete them and create a new one with the same link and my own keywords. But now I can't give them the same name back, firefox says that such a search engine already exists. In general, it doesn't matter to me which letter is there. The main purpose of my appeal is to draw attention to the fact that search engines cannot be edited by default, because it is quite inconvenient. Thanks for the answer (I apologize in advance if I made a grammatical mistake somewhere, I used a translator) My OS: Ubuntu 24.04 LTS; firefox version: 145.0.2 (64-bit)

title: Bookmarks
content:
Hello Mozilla team,

I recently received an update for the latest version of your browser and installed it. However, all of my bookmarks appear to be missing. I have an HTML backup of my bookmarks stored on a USB drive, but when I attempt to import it into the updated browser, I receive a message stating that the file is not recognized as a bookmark file and cannot be uploaded. This is unusual, as I am able to import the same HTML file on other computers and browsers without any issues.

I also tried using the “Sync” function to restore my bookmarks, but this did not work either.

Could you please advise on how I can resolve this issue?

Regards, James

title: Features
content: The wordfeatures refers to the distinct functions, capabilities, or characteristics that define a product, service, tool, or system. Features describe what something can do and what sets it apart — for example, a software program’s features might include a user‑friendly interface, automation options, security settings, or customization ability. By highlighting features, one can understand the strengths and limitations of a thing and decide whether it suits their needs.

title: Tab Groups Lost After Forced Shutdown - All Restoration Methods Failed.
content:
Hello everyone,

My Firefox session closed unexpectedly due to a forced computer shutdown (Mac). Upon restarting, I lost the Tab Group I had open, which included several tabs that had not been recently loaded (suspended tabs).

My core issue is the loss of the Tab Group structure and the URLs of the suspended/unloaded tabs.

✅ Solutions I have already tried (and failed):

1. History Menu: The "Restore Previous Session" option was either unavailable or failed to load the groups. "Recently Closed Windows" also did not show the group.

2. Manual Session File Restoration: I tried replacing the sessionstore.jsonlz4 file in my profile folder with the backups: recovery.jsonlz4 and previous.jsonlz4 (taken from the sessionstore-backups folder). This only restored a few active tabs but did NOT restore the group structure or the suspended/older tabs.

3. History Search: I checked the complete browsing history from the day of the crash (Ctrl+Shift+H). The suspended/unloaded tabs are NOT listed in the history.

4. Add-ons: I was NOT using a third-party extension for tab management. It appears to be a native or specific feature of my Firefox version.

Is there any other location where Firefox stores session backups, or a way to decode the previous.jsonlz4 file to extract the URLs of the suspended tabs that failed to load?

Thank you in advance for your help.
creator: cabar07

title: Pérdida de Grupos de Pestañas (Tab Groups) tras apagado forzoso — Fallan métodos de restauración.
content:
Hola a todos,

Mi sesión de Firefox se cerró inesperadamente debido a un apagado forzoso del computador (Mac). Al reiniciar, perdí el grupo de pestañas que tenía abierto, el cual incluía pestañas que no habían sido cargadas recientemente (suspendidas).

Mi problema principal es la pérdida de la estructura de Grupos de Pestañas y las URLs de las pestañas suspendidas/no cargadas.

✅ Soluciones que ya he intentado (y fallaron):

1. Menú Historial: La opción "Restaurar sesión anterior" no apareció o no cargó los grupos. Las "Ventanas cerradas recientemente" tampoco mostraron el grupo.

2. Restauración Manual de Archivos de Sesión: Intenté reemplazar el archivo sessionstore.jsonlz4 en mi carpeta de perfil con las copias de seguridad: recovery.jsonlz4 y previous.jsonlz4 (tomados de la carpeta sessionstore-backups). Esto solo restauró algunas pestañas activas, pero no la estructura de grupos ni las pestañas suspendidas/antiguas.

3. Búsqueda en el Historial: Revisé el historial completo del día del cierre (Ctrl+Mayús+H). Las pestañas suspendidas/no cargadas NO aparecen en el historial.

4. Uso de Extensiones: No estaba utilizando una extensión de terceros para la gestión de grupos. Parece ser la función nativa o una función específica de mi versión.

¿Hay alguna otra ubicación donde Firefox guarda las copias de seguridad de las sesiones, o alguna manera de decodificar el archivo previous.jsonlz4 para extraer las URLs de las pestañas suspendidas que no se cargaron?

Gracias de antemano por su ayuda.
creator: cabar07
